page.content: and his now famous "jenny" was soon utilised in the local mills and in nearby Blackburn. Initially a great resentment to the new machines caused widespread arson and rioting. Following the boom in the spinning and weaving of cloth came the allied trades of printing, bleaching and dyeing. The need for chemical dyes prompted the establishment of numerous chemical works. By 1826 the power looms were being used in the local mills with its resultant catastrophic effect on the weavers caused renewed rioting. In the 1840's came the steam powered engines and the development of mining in the area. Many small pits were started especially in Oswaldtwistle.
